item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）认为减产即将到来，中国正在准备迄今为止最大的芯片基金，投资者正在等待关键的美国就业数据。夏洛特-休斯-摩根（Charlotte Hughes-Morgan）。【原文：Good morning. Jerome Powell sees cuts on the horizon, China readies its largest chip fund to date and investors await key US jobs data. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Charlotte Hughes-Morgan.】

item.title: 枪手绑架尼日利亚数百名小学生
item.description: 武装分子从尼日利亚北部一所小学绑架了数百名儿童，给这个正在应对生活费用危机的西非国家带来了新的安全挑战。【原文：Armed men abducted hundreds of children from an elementary school in northern Nigeria, triggering a new security challenge in the West African nation that is dealing with a cost-of-living crisis.】

item.title: 债券市场期待就业数据验证降息预期
item.description: 过去几周，债券交易员们加大了对美联储今年降息的押注，他们面临的风险越来越大。【原文：Risks are building for bond traders who’ve spent the last couple of weeks adding to bets on Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 路透社报道：更多日本央行官员倾向于 3 月加息
item.description: 据路透社报道，鉴于对今年工资增长幅度的预期，越来越多的日本央行决策者倾向于在 3 月份取消央行的负利率。【原文：An increasing number of Bank of Japan policymakers are leaning toward scrapping the central bank’s negative interest rate in March given expectations of larger wage increases this year, Reuters reported.】

item.title: 盈利创纪录后，土耳其将银行分红上限设定为 15
item.description: 据知情人士透露，土耳其银行业监管机构决定允许商业贷款机构将其创纪录的 2023 年净收入的 15%作为现金股利支付。【原文：Turkey’s banking regulator decided to allow commercial lenders to pay as much as 15% of their record 2023 net income as cash dividends, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 英镑延续逆势上涨势头，创七个月新高
item.description: 英镑兑美元汇率升至七个月高点，延续了英国货币今年以来跑赢所有主要同类货币的涨势。【原文：The pound rose to a seven-month high against the US dollar, extending a rally that’s seen the British currency outperform all of its major peers this year.】

item.title: 俄罗斯赠送燃料帮助马里在斋月期间照明
item.description: 得益于俄罗斯捐赠的燃料，马里将能够减少斋月期间的断电情况。【原文：Mali will be able to reduce power cuts during the month of Ramadan, thanks to a fuel donation from Russia.】

item.title: 欧洲央行称 2023 年底欧元区薪资关键指标将放宽
每周定格：市场无法预测欧洲央行与美联储的降息竞赛
item.description: 欢迎收看《每周解读》（Weekly Fix），这是一份试图解读经济目标的时事通讯。我是彭博社宏观策略师马库斯-王。【原文：Welcome to the Weekly Fix, the newsletter that tries to make sense of economic targets. I’m Bloomberg’s macro strategist, Marcus Wong.】

item.title: 欧元区经济增长乏力归因于年末贸易下滑
item.description: 欧元区经济在第四季度未能实现扩张的原因在于贸易骤降。【原文：The euro-area economy’s failure to expand in the fourth quarter was down to a plunge in trade.】

item.title: 英国石油公司前首席执行官卢尼 2023 年薪酬减少 180 万英镑
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）前首席执行官伯纳德-卢尼（Bernard Looney）在去年意外辞职后，2023 年的薪酬总额将减少 180 万英镑。【原文：Former BP Plc Chief Executive Bernard Looney took a £1.8 million hit to his total compensation in 2023, following his unexpected resignation last year.】

item.title: 红海危机可能再次引发亚洲通胀，推迟降息时间
item.description: 据《经济学人》信息部称，由于红海暴力升级导致该地区与美国和欧洲贸易伙伴之间的航运受阻，亚洲可能出现经济增长放缓和通胀回升。【原文：Asia could see slower economic growth and a resurgence of inflation as escalating violence in the Red Sea snarls shipping between the region and their trade partners in the US and Europe, according to the Economist Intelligence Unit.】

item.title: 美国银行称科技股创历史最大单周流出量
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，科技股基金创纪录的最大单周资金流出并没有减弱推动美国股市 "猛烈 "上涨的更广泛的兴奋情绪。【原文：The largest weekly outflow on record for technology stock funds hasn’t dimmed the broader euphoria that is driving US equities to “ferocious” gains, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员支持 6 月减息，部分官员对 4 月减息持开放态度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）周四表示，6 月份降息的势头正在增强。【原文：Momentum is building for the June interest-rate cut that European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde flagged on Thursday.】

item.title: 更多关于日本股市为何大涨的信息
item.description:
长期研究日本问题的专家特拉维斯-伦迪（Travis Lundy）谈大型企业的转机。【原文：

Travis Lundy, long-time Japan expert, on the big corporate turnaround.

】

item.title: 中国称印度加强边防部队并未缓解紧张局势
item.description: 北京表示，新德里释放 10,000 多名士兵驻扎在双方有争议的边境地区的举动不会缓解紧张局势，但补充说，北京愿意与对手合作以维持和平。【原文：Beijing said New Delhi’s move to free up 10,000 more soldiers to station on their disputed frontier won’t reduce tensions but added that it is willing to work with its rival to keep the peace.】

item.title: Grifols股价因审计师认可其年度账目而上涨
item.description: 在审计师签署了这家西班牙血液制品生产商的年度账目后，Grifols SA 股价大涨。【原文：Grifols SA shares surged after an auditor signed off on the annual accounts of the Spanish maker of blood products.】

item.title: 快速时尚利润率、阿美石油公司资本支出将在下周欧洲、中东和非洲地区财报中占据主导地位
item.description: 随着欧洲财报季即将结束，时尚零售商 Zalando SE 和 Inditex SA 将在下周接过衣钵。随着低成本竞争对手的步步紧逼，它们正努力提高利润率，并将库存保持在可控水平。【原文：Fashion retailers Zalando SE and Inditex SA take up the mantle next week as Europe’s earnings season draws to a close. With low-cost rivals nipping at their heels, they’re trying to bolster margins and keep inventory at manageable levels.】

item.title: 欧洲央行穆勒称通胀放缓但需要更多信心
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马迪斯-穆勒表示，欧元区的通胀率正逐步接近2%的目标，但官员们仍需对这一趋势的持续性抱有更多信心。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Madis Muller said inflation in the euro area is gradually approaching the 2% target, but officials still need more confidence that the trend will persist.】

item.title: 雷恩称欧洲央行将在四月和六月讨论降息问题
item.description: 2024年1月28日，周日，芬兰赫尔辛基，芬兰银行行长、总统候选人奥利-雷恩在芬兰总统选举期间向媒体发表讲话。在芬兰总统选举中，前总理亚历山大-斯图布（Alexander Stubb）和前外长佩卡-哈维斯托（Pekka Haavisto）领先，即将在两周后举行决选。摄影师：Roni Rekomaa/Bloomberg【原文：Olli Rehn, governor of the Bank of Finland and presidential candidate, speaks to members of the media during the Finnish Presidential election in Helsinki, Finland, on Sunday, Jan. 28, 2024. Finland's presidential race saw former Prime Minister Alexander Stubb and former Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto in the lead, nearing a runoff in two weeks. Photographer: Roni Rekomaa/Bloomberg】

item.title: 似曾相识的土耳其大选：午夜法令再次困扰银行
item.description: 随着大选的临近和里拉的抛售，土耳其决策者不得不重拾旧习，回避提高利率的前景，转而通过微观管理贷款人来控制货币。【原文：Turkish policymakers are having to revert to old habits with the approach of elections and the lira selling off, sidestepping the prospect of higher interest rates in favor of micro-managing lenders to keep the currency in check.】

item.title: 里拉将迎来 8 个月来最差一周，预期波动性上升
item.description: 由于通胀率高于预期，加上对储备减少的担忧，里拉本周的跌势使土耳其货币有望创下自7月21日以来的最差单周表现。本月地方选举在即，预计货币波动将持续剧烈。【原文：The lira’s losses this week are putting Turkey’s currency on course for its worst weekly performance since July 21 as higher-than-expected inflation, combined with concerns over dwindling reserves, weigh on the currency. The volatility is expected to remain high this month in the runup to local elections.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称欧洲央行极有可能在四月或六月降息
卡扎克称欧洲央行一旦开始降息将避免 "自动驾驶
Klarna 首席执行官向谷歌寻求 "完美 "的上市蓝图
item.description: Klarna Bank AB 首席执行官塞巴斯蒂安-西米亚特考夫斯基（Sebastian Siemiatkowski）正在从谷歌获得灵感，准备 "很快 "进行首次公开募股。【原文：Klarna Bank AB Chief Executive Officer Sebastian Siemiatkowski is taking inspiration from Google as he prepares for an initial public offering “quite soon.”】

item.title: 高盛突然逆转退出日本交易银行业务
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）在宣布计划进军日本大公司现金流管理业务不到一年后，就退出了日本的交易银行业务。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is exiting transaction banking in Japan, less than a year after announcing plans to enter the business of managing cash flows for big companies in the country.】

item.title: 德国工业生产自四月以来首次增长
item.description: 德国 1 月份的工业生产出现了九个月来的首次增长，尽管其长期的疲软很可能已将欧洲最大的经济体拖入衰退。【原文：German industrial production rose in January for the first time in nine months, though its protracted weakness has probably already dragged Europe’s largest economy into a recession.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
item.description: 伦敦城。摄影师：Mike Kemp/Getty Images【原文：The City of London. Photographer: Mike Kemp/Getty Images】

item.title: 据说亚洲顶级家禽公司 Japfa 的所有者正在酝酿私有化交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印尼第二大家禽生产商 Japfa Ltd. 的所有者正在考虑将这家在新加坡上市的公司私有化，并已开始商谈贷款事宜。【原文：Owners of Japfa Ltd., the second-largest poultry maker in Indonesia, are considering taking the Singapore-listed company private and have started talks for a loan that would back any such move, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马修斯关闭上海办事处，加入资产管理公司撤退行列
item.description: 资产管理公司马修斯国际资本管理有限责任公司（Matthews International Capital Management LLC）将关闭其上海办事处，从而为削减中国大陆业务的全球公司名单再添一员。【原文：Asset manager Matthews International Capital Management LLC is closing its Shanghai office, adding to the list of global firms that have cut back in mainland China.】
